EmailTemplate.description: The invitation to the HCI Webinar
EmailTemplate.name: 16May2012:HCI Webinar.HCI Webinar 16May2012 Invite
EmailTemplate.subject: Engaging Independent Contractors: Whose Role Is It, Procurement or HR or Both?
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Independent consultants are becoming a more strategic component of the workforce plan, but is it a vendor sourcing task or a talent acquisition task? Please join me at this webinar where we will discuss how and why collaboration between HR and Procurment is critical when you engage independent consultants.
Engaging Independent Contractors: Whose role is it, Procurement or HR or Both? <http://lists.humancapitalinstitute.org/lt.php?c=6248&m=4066&nl=2&s=da97b71df56065174e8f3296c674d15b&lid=141788&l=-http--www.hci.org/cfe/track/independent-contractor-engagement>
DATE/TIME: Wednesday, May 16, 2012 | 12:00 pm EDT
PRESENTER: Debra Berns, Deputy General Counsel, Employment & Benefits, UnitedHealth Group Inc.
Ann Odehnal, Staff VP, Talent Management, WellPoint, Inc.
Chris Dwyer, Senior Analyst, Aberdeen Group, Inc.
Jay Lash, VP of Market Strategies, MBO Enterprise Solutions
UNDERWRITER: MBO Enterprise Solutions <http://lists.humancapitalinstitute.org/lt.php?c=6248&m=4066&nl=2&s=da97b71df56065174e8f3296c674d15b&lid=141788&l=-http--www.hci.org/cfe/track/independent-contractor-engagement>
Do HR and Procurement leaders talk about independent contractors in their organizations? For the sake of legal risks, optimal performance, and business strategy execution, they should.
Thank you, Jay Lash
